page.title: 10Leighfield non-arable farm 2
page.content: 35 acres of grassland are farmed with another 15 outside the area as a small mixed livestock farm. This is a family hobby farm and does not produce the main source of income. The farm buildings (832059) hold the pigs:1 boar, 4 sows and their litters which are all Large Whites and are fattened and sold. They also house 200 hens which are kept for egg production. On the grassland are kept an average of 10 young cattle which are fattened and sold, and 1 Jacob ram, 30 ewes and their lambs which are sold for meat. Jacob sheep are kept because the farmer likes old fashioned breeds and they produce very sweet meat as well as attractive fleeces for sheepskin rugs,although they are not ready for sale as quickly as modern breeds.
